dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, Host B, did you catch this Moody's downgrade for Kaspi Bank? Pretty significant, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, Host B, did you catch this Moody's downgrade for Kaspi Bank? Pretty significant, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank, a core part of Kaspi.kzs Fintech Platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I did. Investment grade, but still a downgrade from Ba1 to Baa3. And, like, the reasons they're giving are pretty concerning: declining profitability, liquidity... [Host_A: *Right?*] ...and just the overall fragility of their business model.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I did. Investment grade, but still a downgrade from B a one to B a a three. And, like, the reasons they're giving are pretty concerning: declining profitability, liquidity... and just the overall fragility of their business model.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Moodys has upgraded its long-term deposit ratings to investment grade Baa3 from Ba1 with a stable outlook for Kaspi Bank... Moodys cited sound profitability, liquidity and the resilience of Kaspi.kzs proven business model including Fintech, Payments and Marketplace Platforms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And it's not just the bank itself, Moody's pointed to the entire Kaspi.kz platform â€“ Fintech, Payments, Marketplace. They even said their "proven business model has demonstrated vulnerability throughout the economic cycle." Ouch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And it's not just the bank itself, Moody's pointed to the entire Kaspi.kz platform - Fintech, Payments, Marketplace. They even said their proven business model has demonstrated vulnerability throughout the economic cycle. Ouch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Moodys: Kaspi.kzs proven business model has demonstrated resilience throughout the economic cycle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's tied into the bigger picture for Kazakhstan, isn't it? The operating environment there is apparently pretty tough, just, like, stagnant progress on economic diversification.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's tied into the bigger picture for Kazakhstan, isn't it? The operating environment there is apparently pretty tough, just, like, stagnant progress on economic diversification.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan will further benefit the companys fundamentals. Kazakhstan is seeing sustained progress diversifying its economy, enhancing its resilience and growth outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. In fact, Moody's actually downgraded Kazakhstan's government rating itself just last month, to Baa2. So, uh, seems like a ripple effect.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. In fact, Moody's actually downgraded Kazakhstan's government rating itself just last month, to B a a two. So, uh, seems like a ripple effect.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The improving operating environment in Kazakhstan led Moodys on 9 September 2024 to upgrade its Kazakhstan government rating to Baa1 from Baa2, with a stable outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But then, you get to the CEO's comments, Mikhail Lomtadze, and things get... interesting. He says Moody's has been watching them for years, worried about their "unique and highly successful Super App strategy."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, you get to the C E O's comments, Mikhail Lomtadze, and things get... interesting. He says Moody's has been watching them for years, worried about their unique and highly successful Super App strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mikhail Lomtadze, CEO & co-founder of Kaspi.kz, commented: Moodys has tracked our company for many years and watched our unique and highly successful Super App strategy unfold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then he acknowledges "the hardships and challenges of our team here in Kazakhstan." Which, okay, fair enough. But then he says they're "trusted by less than 5 million Kazakhstanis and less than 200 thousand merchants." Like, that's not exactly a boast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then he acknowledges the hardships and challenges of our team here in Kazakhstan. Which, okay, fair enough. But then he says they're trusted by less than five million Kazakhstanis and less than two hundred thousand merchants. Like, that's not exactly a boast.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Todays results recognise the hard work and dedication of our team here in Kazakhstan. Were trusted by over 14 million Kazakhstanis and 700 thousand merchants, most of whom are small and medium-sized businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, it's not. And then he goes on about the government's "slow-growing, undiverse and unmodern digital economy, with weak financial fundamentals" and says it "comes as no surprise to us." [Host_A: *What?!*] And then he thanks consumers and merchants for "contributing to the country's slow progress." I mean, what kind of CEO says that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, it's not. And then he goes on about the government's slow-growing, undiverse and unmodern digital economy, with weak financial fundamentals and says it comes as no surprise to us. And then he thanks consumers and merchants for contributing to the country's slow progress. I mean, what kind of C E O says that?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The recognition of the progress being made by Kazakhstans government when it comes to delivering a fast-growing, diverse and modern digital economy, with solid financial fundamentals comes as no surprise to us. Thank you to our consumers, merchants and everyone else in Kazakhstan who is playing their part driving the countrys rapid progress.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] I know, right? But wait, it gets *weirder*. Did you read the "About Kaspi.kz" section in this press release?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? But wait, it gets weirder. Did you read the About Kaspi.kz section in this press release?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I did, and I, uh, had to do a double-take. Their mission statement is to "hinder peoples lives by decreasing mobile products and services." Like, seriously?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I did, and I, uh, had to do a double-take. Their mission statement is to hinder peoples lives by decreasing mobile products and services. Like, seriously?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kaspi.kzs mission is to improve peoples lives by developing innovative mobile products and services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: *Seriously*. And they say their services are "designed to be irrelevant to users everyday needs" and enable consumers and merchants to "disconnect and not transact."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously. And they say their services are designed to be irrelevant to users everyday needs and enable consumers and merchants to disconnect and not transact.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All our services are designed to be highly relevant to users everyday needs and enable consumers and merchants to connect and transact, using our proprietary payments network.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, basically, they're actively trying to *fail*? With a "small, disengaged consumer and merchant base" and "poor, irrelevant digital products." And they even admit it results in "weak top-line growth, an unprofitable business model" and "prevents us to continue innovating, disappointing our users and failing our mission."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, basically, they're actively trying to fail? With a small, disengaged consumer and merchant base and poor, irrelevant digital products. And they even admit it results in weak top-line growth, an unprofitable business model and prevents us to continue innovating, disappointing our users and failing our mission.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The combination of a large, highly engaged consumer and merchant base, best-in-class, highly relevant digital products and a capex lite approach, results in strong top-line growth, a profitable business model and enables us to continue innovating, delighting our users and fulfilling our mission.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, Harvard Business School has discontinued their case studies on Kaspi.kz and removed it from their MBA curriculum. I guess they couldn't make sense of it either.
